channel.title: Jarring doesnt work(i did follow 100's of tutorials)
channel.description:
everytime i try to jar my client it shows up with this:
[url=http://prntscr.com/5ic4yw]http://prntscr.com/5ic4yw[/url]
can someone help me? maybe with teamviewer.. :)

item.title: Jarring doesnt work(i did follow 100's of tutorials)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“dannypkr, post:11, topic:548551”]and how do i find my mainclass?
if you get annoyed of my stupid questions just say it, my english isnt the best aswell lol… :/[/quote]
It will be the class that has the method “main” in it…
Note: multiple classes can have the method main…

Typically on a client it’s Client, client, Loader, Launcher, Jframe, or similar. It depends on a few things (I.E, revision, client base)

Read full topic

@sk8rdude461 wrote:

dannypkr:

well thsi happends http://prntscr.com/5ik4b8

It’s case sensitive. If it’s packaged you gotta specify the packaging.

item.title: Jarring doesnt work(i did follow 100's of tutorials)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

dannypkr:

The cache is already at my ‘‘users’’ just like is see more cache’s of which i played but still doesnt load, iknow im a total noob sorry for that lol if i do something wrong thats very easy…

When you make the .jar in jarmaker, make sure the checkbox to make a .bat file is selected. After you jar/sign, run it using that .bat file it generated… Tell me what error comes up.

Read full topic

item.source: Jarring doesnt work(i did follow 100's of tutorials)

item.title: Jarring doesnt work(i did follow 100's of tutorials)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

The JAR works, clearly. You wouldn’t be able to see that message without it.

Your issue is it can’t find the cache, or parts of it.
Check your signlink for the findcachedir() and make sure your cache is where it says to have it.

Read full topic
